intro: Cyphanthera albicans subsp. notabilis, commonly known as the white-flowered cyphanthera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has small, compound leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
